Would you prefer a thick red outline delineating every hitbox at all times? Because that's how the game actually works.
look I want Skill shots to match the size of the hitboxes is that so hard to ask. I mean we should have an idea of how far we have to go to dodge since sight is the only thing were working on.

The visuals will never fully line up with the hitboxes. League is a 2D game projected into 3D with character models and spells. It lets you have a skin with a fancy flowing cape and not get hit when a spell connects with the cape - because the hitbox is based on the *box* that the character is suppose to take up. Additionally, elevation changes mess with a users's perception of where an effect will hit.

Act like this cant be done, but it definitely can. fact of the matter is there have been quite a few problematic Skill Shots that dont have visuals that match the box. There are plenty of abilities that have great hit boxes for Example Ekkos Q, W, and R show exactly where it is with Visuals. I dont think its difficult to make skill shots match hit boxes or make champions hitboxes match their character model. You make it seem like its impossible its not and it wouldnt be exactly difficult.
You can come closer to matching, sure. But it won't ever be an *exact* match so long as character hit boxes are boxes, which is going to be as long as the game uses it's current engine.

Fair enough. Its time for them to upgrade the game. They could fix so many things if rendered on the right engine. It would improve quality of the game massively. Plus I would love to see some heavily updated graphics.

I can't believe you're actually defending this lol. Ridiculous. The hook CLEARLY misses. Everyone who has a history of playing video games understands how hitboxes work. This case to me is completely unacceptable.
Nothing I said was specific to this clip.

If the unit and spell hitboxes touch, the ability creates a tether between Thresh and the target like it's supposed to.

its not only thresh, it happen a lot with blitz (and i did it a lot with blitz lol)

idk where i heard this but theres some sort of lollipop system in some skills shots where the skill shot will search in a little bigger area at the very end.

https://youtu.be/e7WjK02UAgg

Imagine if thresh didn't have to relie on his team to actually kill people and had a 10 sec CD hook. 

Thresh hook looks bad because the visual does not match the hitbox from every angle and the line just snaps to predetermined place halfway on the player model of whoever it hits.

I've not seen these kinds of past max range/off to the side hooks landing until the past month or so and now I see them every game. Never had any problems judging the hook hitboxes over the past 5+ years, never seen hooks miss but still land in 5 years of watching pro play. They probably just messed something up with the coding, since Riot is god awful. I had to google it to see if I missed an update or something because it's happening too often.

ya that was bullshot

That's not Thresh hook being too wide. That's how hitboxes work. Champs have a square hitbox, the hook hit the corner of Corki's. That's a mechanic that anyone can use on any champ with skill shots. If Corki stayed in the same position but turned his character model slightly up or down, the hook would miss the hitbox.

It's not really that, it's just the lollipop effect. Skillshots like Thresh Hook, Blitz Hook, etc. check in a circular area round their final destination, and if anything is in that extra forgiving area it hits them.

{{champion:25}} 
Also lol.

I agree that hooks should have a hitbox to the size of the hook model itself. This is a common thing with LoL I think. Hitboxes are almost always larger than they seem. I remember being so mad playing into {{champion:420}} and dodging her Qs, or so I thought because I was outside of the outline that her tentacles make... but in reality it still hit me. Riot has fixed her hitbox since then, but when I complained about it in the boards no one agreed with me. I think this is just straight up silly. False advertising.
Lollipop effect. All hooks have it and it is annoying as heck. Nothing that can be done.. i won't explain it.. go find... vandiril i think it was that made a video on it.
Just some standard lollipopping, it looks odd sometimes, but its needed for how thin the actual hook model is.

I've been wanting a fix for this for ages but people, for whatever reason, act like this is a problem that doesn't exist.
